alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 5:48PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Laurel, McCreary, Wayne and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Bell, Clay and Knox. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 545 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain moving across the area. Rainfall amounts could exceed an inch in places between 6 and 8 pm. Excessive runoff will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts, especially in low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... London, Williamsburg, Barbourville, Manchester, Whitley City, Faber, Woodbine, Rockholds, Barton, Moore Hill, Wilton, Walden, North Corbin, Deering, Rye, Wofford, Perkins, Goldbug, Clio and Dorthae.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
